intro: Juanulloa ochracea, commonly known as the yellow-flowered Juanulloa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
